title: UK esports firm Gfinity see revenues almost double to £7.9m
text:
British esports firm Gfinity saw its revenues almost double to £7.9m for the 12 months ended June 30 amid growing interest in professional video gaming.

The business, which runs its own arena in West London, also saw its operating losses drop to £8.6m from a larger loss of £12.2m in the previous year.

It hopes to reach breakeven earnings by 2021 as it continues to reduce its losses.

Gfinity was founded in 2012 and is hoping to become a key part of the growing business of professional gaming.

It announced earlier this month that it will produce a reality series around Formula 1’s upcoming esports racing series in which 10 teams compete to win $500,000 (£384,000).
